support_summary: UBR2 physically binds the ATXN3c isoform (MS and Co-IP evidence)

functions.cellular_process: Protein ubiquitination and degradation via the N-degron pathway and ERAD.
functions.effect_description: ATXN3c interacts with UBR2 to potentially modulate its ligase activity or the processing of its substrates in the N-degron pathway.
biological_consequence: ATXN3c → Binds UBR2 at the ER membrane → Modulates UBR2-mediated ubiquitination of N-degron substrates → Promotes recognition and polyubiquitination of specific targets → Facilitates proteasomal entry and protein turnover.
specific_effects: Isoform-specific binding via the C-terminal hydrophobic tail of ATXN3c
Co-localization of ATXN3c and UBR2 at the ER membrane

evidence.paper_title: Physiological and pathophysiological characteristics of ataxin-3 isoforms
evidence.relevant_quote: ATXN3c specifically interacts with NGLY1 and UBR2... both involved in the ERAD pathway... interaction with NGLY1 and UBR2 suggests a role in ERAD.

mechanism_correction: Similar to NGLY1, the interaction with UBR2 is specific to the ATXN3c isoform. ATXN3c binds UBR2, an E3 ubiquitin ligase of the N-degron pathway, potentially to coordinate the ubiquitination and degradation of specific substrates at the ER membrane.
mechanism: Protein ubiquitination and degradation via the N-degron pathway and ERAD.
effect: ATXN3c interacts with UBR2 to potentially modulate its ligase activity or the processing of its substrates in the N-degron pathway.
summary: ATXN3 activates UBR2 to modulate n-degron pathway modulation, ultimately affecting facilitates proteasomal entry and protein turnover.

evidence.paper_title: Physiological and pathophysiological characteristics of ataxin-3 isoforms
evidence.relevant_quote: ATXN3c specifically interacts with NGLY1 and UBR2... both involved in the ERAD pathway... interaction with NGLY1 and UBR2 suggests a role in ERAD.

initial_pathway.reasoning: ATXN3 interacts with UBR2, an E3 ligase of the N-degron pathway, to modulate the stability of specific proteasomal substrates.
